tool_description: Free feed with IOCs -  malicious URLs, domains, IPs, and hashes. [Website: https://tweetfeed.live]
name: TweetFeed
title: TweetFeed

api_list.name: v1

required_parameters.name: time
required_parameters.description:
Select 1 of these timeframes:

**today** - Today starting 00:00 UTC)
**week** - Last 7 days
**month** - Last 30 days
**year** - Last 365 days

optional_parameters.name: filter1
optional_parameters.description:
Can be an specific user, type or tag:

Type → **url** / **domain** / **ip** / **sha256** / **md5**
Tag → **phishing** / **ransomware** / **CobaltStrike** ...
User → **@malwrhunterteam** / **@1ZRR4H** / **@MBThreatIntel** / ... (don't forget the @)

optional_parameters.name: filter2
optional_parameters.description:
Can be an specific user, type or tag:

Type → **url** / **domain** / **ip** / **sha256** / **md5**
Tag → **phishing** / **ransomware** / **CobaltStrike** ...
User → **@malwrhunterteam** / **@1ZRR4H** / **@MBThreatIntel** / ... (don't forget the @)

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tweetfeed.p.rapidapi.com/v1/today/phishing/url"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tweetfeed.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tweetfeed.p.rapidapi.com/v1/{time}/{filter1}/{filter2}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tweetfeed.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
